page.title: 05Life of Carol (a.m.)
page.content: On Wednesday mornings I get up at a quarter to seven. I'm always the last person awake. My mum gets ready for work, she works at a lady's house cleaning, washing and dusting. My dad is already at work; he mends motor cycles. My sister and I are soon ready for school and we leave home at eight thirty five. The school bell rings at eight fifty five. Our first lesson is French followed by handwriting or SRA. Assembly is next, taken by one of the classes. At a quarter to eleven it is playtime when I usually play elastic but if it is raining I help Joanne Rive to look after the second infant class. From eleven until twelve it is Maths. I am at present working with cubes and cuboids. I live in the village so at lunch time I cross the road and walk home, where my mum has prepared sandwiches for the family.
